issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Signifies completion of tasks, info requests, etc.
resolution.name: Completed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I discovered I was only able to delete a stack if I had the General tab in focus.  If any other tab is selected, Events, for example, I am unable to delete the stack.  There are no warnings or errors, it just doesn't get deleted.

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a stack
# Click on the stack to bring up details view
# Click on any tab except the 'General' tab
# Click the 'Actions' drop-down menu and click 'Delete stack'

What should happen:  You should get a dialogue box that confirms if you want to delete the stack or not
What actually happpens: Nothing, no prompt or delete occurs
fields.summary: Can only delete stack on the General tab.

comments.body: https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1498
[~lnajjar], the stack in "deleted" state is returned to us by the back end. If we wanted to never show "deleted" stacks, I suppose we could filter for that.
That sounds good. When the user deletes a stack, the stack should disappear from the Stacks list.

If a stack is fully deleted and there are no resources left, and there's no action that would fire it back up (like you can with a stopped instance for example), it makes sense to remove it from the landing page, I agree. This is really true for any resource type...
I will filter deleted items and remove "delete complete" from the search facet options.
Need [~dkavanagh] to make the changes he described in Comments.
I did make the changes. I should have noted when the work was complete, but the PR was updated yesterday.

David, I can¹t figure out how to create a valid stack. So I can¹t test
your fix.

Could we do a 10-minute desktop sharing so you could walk me through what
to do?

What is a good time for you? I am on Central Time.


Lawrence


On 8/6/15, 11:58 AM, "David Kavanagh (JIRA)"

sure, but first, try setting your ufshost like this:

ufshost = e-39.autoqa.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com

then use "basic instance" sample stack. If that doesn't work, we can screen share.
I put a stack on the dev cloud in admin@acct 00 called "LawrenceDeletMe" for you to play with

And I tried to delete that stack from the Events tab. After deleting, it still appeared in the Stacks list.

What is going on?
[~lnajjar] What did the stack status say exactly? Was it "Delete in progress" or "Delete complete" ? You will see the in progress till that's complete.
Did not delete from Events tab. Back to you.
added delay. now, see stack go to "delete in progress" state upon return to main page.

[~lnajjar], I created a stack with your name on it for you to test with. I'm also attaching the template file to this ticket and you could use that to upload a template and create your own simple stack.

Thanks for the file, [~dkavanagh]. When I drag it to my desktop or open it, it is a URL.

Could you please tell me how to save it to my machine as a .json file?
I right-click and use "save link as"

[~dkavanagh], I managed to create a stack on my own. I could delete it from the General tab, but Delete did nothing from the Template and Events tabs.

Could you please figure out why Delete did nothing on the Template and Events tabs when using Safari?

I can only imagine you weren't testing with the right code.

I just created a stack and deleted from the template tab using FF and created another and was able to delete from the events tab in safari.

Yes,[~dkavanagh]! It now works.

UX review passed. Ready for code review.
PR 1498 merged

Verified.  I was able to delete stacks from different tabs.
